title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 September 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:11 <vmassol> has quit  
00:19 <movement> has joined #xwiki  
00:19 <movement> hey, PDF export isn't using a fixed-width font for {{code language="none"}} ? XWiki Enterprise 2.7.1.34853  
00:26 <polx> has quit  
00:37 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
00:41 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-extensiondistribution \* reffc073 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/effc073aa11d86dd22cfa4affe9a912873ef8067 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-script/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/script/internal/ExtensionManagerScriptService.java : XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/1KfJZg  
00:41 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-extensiondistribution \* rccff8b0 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ccff8b079ef01b32d2aab2be0bb9c85207533a51 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/extension.vm : XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/oex5UQ  
00:41 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-extensiondistribution \* rb80dddb https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b80dddb3336737c2cae9a3b44298019e160b340f / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties : Improve messages. - http://git.io/6tCxLA  
00:41 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-extensiondistribution \* r4fb75fc https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/4fb75fcb7654c66956d8e428d17c3a4cf33622a1 / (4 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/m\_5gNw  
00:41 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-extensiondistribution \* r9362b95 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/9362b95339420d85f2a21d93c6a8e86a106d1ae1 / (66 files in 45 dirs): Merge branch 'master' of github.com:xwiki/xwiki-platform into feature-extensiondistribution (+31 more commits...) - http://git.io/KnDcXQ

14:38 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* re2b3974 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e2b397485c330d168008bec06c8697a93e9edcee / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-uiextension/xwiki-platform-uiextension-test/src/main/java/org/xwiki/uiextension/internal/HelloWorldUIExtension.java : XWIKI-649 : Mechanism for inserting custom content in pre-existing code - http://git.io/nDxTAA  
15:01 <vmassol> has quit  
15:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:19 <movement> has left #xwiki  
15:45 <ries> has joined #xwiki  
16:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
16:44 <vmassol> mflorea: I've built XE jetty/hsqldb and removed the data/ dir  
16:44 <vmassol> I was expecting to see some screen asking me to install XE  
16:45 <vmassol> ?  
16:46 <+mflorea> vmassol: what do you get when you start xwiki?  
16:46 <+mflorea> I mean, when you access a page?  
16:52 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
16:54 <vmassol> mflorea: just the standard page doesn't exist  
16:54 <vmassol> "The requested document could not be found."  
16:55 <+mflorea> ok, check if you have the xwiki-platform-extension-distribution jar in WEB-INF/lib  
16:55 <vmassol> not there  
16:56 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r8629b9a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/8629b9acffb107804eb18ffacfe0d011ed24bde4 / (9 files in 5 dirs): XWIKI-649 : Mechanism for inserting custom content in pre-existing code - http://git.io/4-hr5A  
16:56 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r7d2cc86 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/7d2cc86e6dfc5f1274e8f61b6aa4e21f0be57dc4 / (3 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7927 : Create an entry point for all available applications inside the wiki - http://git.io/BIn66A  
16:56 <+mflorea> ok, I need to add the dep in exterprise-war pom  
16:56 <+mflorea> can you copy the jar and try again?  
16:56 <vmassol> ok I'll copy it, anything else I need to copy?  
16:56 <+mflorea> only this jar  
16:56 <vmassol> ok  
16:57 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r515e0f0 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/515e0f0a145337d53d9fb25ff18656ec1f3fb6c3 / xwiki-enterprise-web/pom.xml : XWIKI-7927 : Create an entry point for all available applications inside the wiki - http://git.io/MeA7Ng  
16:57 <+mflorea> there were some changes I had to made, but I think Thomas includes them in the build. Let me check the list  
16:58 <vmassol> mflorea: all broken, will paste  
16:58 <vmassol> nasty NPE  
16:59 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/3637898  
17:05 <+mflorea> checkig  
17:08 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:14 <+mflorea> vmassol: it looks like $services.distribution.state != NONE and $services.distribution.distributionExtension is null. I bet $services.distribution.state is null also. Can you edit distribution.vm and change line 58 in:  
17:14 <+mflorea> #if (!$distributionState || $distributionState == 'NONE' )  
17:14 <+mflorea> fixing this in platform  
17:14 <vmassol> ok  
17:14 <vmassol> trying  
17:15 <vmassol> mflorea: same  
17:15 <+mflorea> still NPE?  
17:15 <vmassol> yes  
17:16 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* rcdde4aa https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/cdde4aa26b5b863e83f68446e2a98715f5eea1b5 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-8174 : Add an entry for the Blog in the applications panel - http://git.io/AHV9NQ  
17:16 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* rb07110a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b07110a9660b81dfda15fa984e24d918e416aab8 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-panels/xwiki-platform-panels-ui/src/main/resources/Panels/QuickLinks.xml : XWIKI-8176 : Add an entry for the User Directory in the applications panel - http://git.io/EXHjyw  
17:16 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* ra1691c5 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a1691c53209cb06927f59d262e8d6db97d1e5878 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-8175 : Add an entry for the Dashboard in the applications panel - http://git.io/XGqiuw  
17:16 <vmassol> mflorea: you can reproduce easily by building XE jetty+hsqldb from master  
17:17 <+mflorea> ok, so distribution state is neither null nor NONE. Looks like a bug. Let me check the list of changes Thomas told me to make.  
17:21 <+Denis> jvdrean: Why are you closing all issue related to hidden document as duplicate ?  
17:22 <+jvdrean> I'm closing the last one in a minute  
17:23 <+Denis> but why ?  
17:23 <+jvdrean> XWIKI-7568  
17:24 <+jvdrean> I was expecting the bot to put the URL to the issue :)  
17:24 <vmassol> bad bot!  
17:24 <+Denis> nb, but I still do not understand why ?  
17:26 <+mflorea> vmassol: you need to add  
17:26 <+mflorea> XWiki-Extension-Id: org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-web  
17:26 <+mflorea> in webapps/xwiki/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF  
17:26 <+mflorea> Thomas committed this in a xwiki-enterprise branch but it seems the commit was lost..  
17:27 <vmassol> mflorea: it's there  
17:27 <vmassol> :)  
17:27 <+mflorea> it's there?  
17:27 <+jvdrean> Denis: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/04c66ae7a6634896fca110872932972e8d17329f#diff-5  
17:27 <vmassol> yep  
17:27 <+mflorea> I don't see it in the pom.. I'm not sure how it is generated  
17:28 <+jvdrean> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7568 fixed the issue since searchDocuments does not filter out document marked as hidden anymore.  
17:29 <+Denis> ok, and how these will get filtered ?  
17:29 <+mflorea> I can't find 'XWiki-Extension-Id' anywhere in the platform and enterprise  
17:31 <vmassol> no idea but it's there :)  
17:32 <+jvdrean> Denis:  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise40#HNewtechnicalcontenthidingsystem  
17:32 <+mflorea> vmassol: ok, let me build and try myself..  
17:32 <vmassol> ok  
17:33 <+jvdrean> hidden documents are filter: 1) if you're using the query manager, 2) if you manually add the hidden filter to the query  
17:33 <+jvdrean> as in $services.query.xwql("where doc.name like 'S%'").setFilter("hidden").execute()  
17:35 <vmassol> Denis: read the release notes :)  
17:35 <vmassol> (they're surely very good!)  
17:35 <+Denis> jvdrean: so you means that every where the query manager is still unused and all existing application will need to be customized ?  
17:35 <vmassol> ah didn't see jvdrean had copied them above ;)  
17:36 <+Denis> vmassol: read, but found this way of solving a complete step back for a feature available since a quite long time  
17:36 <+jvdrean> Denis: yes, I did the modification (searchDocuments -> query manager) where it needed to be done in XE  
17:37 <+jvdrean> were you using the feature before 4.0 ?  
17:38 <+Denis> sure, I have  
17:38 <+mflorea> vmassol: ok, found where it is specified: in the xwiki-commons pom, maven-jar-plugin and maven-war-plugin configuration.  
17:38 <+Denis> mainly, it is there by default  
17:39 <+jvdrean> yes it was but it never made it to the UI because of the bugs we found when we started using it in XE (in the blog space)  
17:40 <+jvdrean> that's why I assumed it was ok to remove the buggy filtering in searchDocuments  
17:40 <+jvdrean> and implement properly in the query manager  
17:40 <+jvdrean> s/implement/implement it/  
17:43 <evalica> has quit  
17:46 <+Denis> I do not say that it is bad, but I do not remember a discussion about it. IMO, there is potential side effects on existing applications. This does not means I want you to revert, but I am surprised by the fix  
17:49 <+jvdrean> Denis: there was this thread http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/lbzwe3k5hrowfabh  
17:51 <+jvdrean> this one too v  
17:51 <+jvdrean> http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/sfd5lwlyo5gzcz3t  
17:54 <+Denis> jvdrean: does the filtering still occurs on the same db field, or on an object as proposed ?  
17:55 <+jvdrean> Denis: on the same db field  
17:56 <+jvdrean> (see my first mail in the thread)  
17:57 <vmassol> has quit  
18:01 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:04 <polx> has quit  
18:05 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
18:09 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rb834d1f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b834d1f73b8f481992370c00ad0a77d578bb09f5 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/distribution.vm : XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/j8oPjA  
18:10 <+mflorea> vmassol: fixed. please try the latest distribution.vm  
18:11 <vmassol> mflorea: thanks  
18:12 <+mflorea> (you still need to register a snapshot maven repo, but at least you won't get the Velocity error anymore)  
18:14 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r4f42504 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/4f42504c038ee3c38a68edacd9df2578b6732e21 / xwiki-enterprise-web/pom.xml : XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/GfEZxQ  
18:21 <+mflorea> I'm trying the install. I definitely need to implement the live update of the install plan log... you wait too much without any feedback..  
18:58 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r09fc354 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/09fc35427ef3460949461ff654429d3f3308538e / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/yXqM6Q  
19:21 <vmassol> has quit  
19:28 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:28 <mflorea> has quit  
20:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
21:03 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
21:05 <Denis> has quit  
21:37 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
21:42 <ries> has quit  
21:42 <ries\_> has joined #xwiki  
22:40 <perlygatekeeper2> has joined #xwiki  
22:40 <perlygatekeeper2> hello?  
22:43 <@cjd> howdy  
22:45 <perlygatekeeper2> oh hey  
22:45 <perlygatekeeper2> I'm having an issue with using a block of text inside of an ordered list  
22:46 <@cjd> the renderer is not my specific area but I might have some ideas, what's happening?  
22:48 <perlygatekeeper2> ok I'm basically making a list, one of the elements of which will contain a small (3-5 line) snippet of code  
22:48 <perlygatekeeper2> I am using the code macro to accomplish this  
22:49 <perlygatekeeper2> the macro seems to sometimes output it's contents in span tags and other times in div tags  
22:49 <perlygatekeeper2> the div tags look the best, a nice offset text box  
22:50 <@cjd> hmm, I'm not sure what the expected behavior is in this case but there is a consept of a "block" display as opposed to an inline display.  
22:50 <perlygatekeeper2> the div tags are used if I put blank lines around the macro, but this cause the autonumbered list to be split into 2 lists  
22:50 <perlygatekeeper2> yes  
22:51 <perlygatekeeper2> I would like to force the block display, without needing the blank lines  
22:51 <@cjd> yes, putting empty lines around something makes it into a block  
22:51 <perlygatekeeper2> is there another way to get a div  
22:51 <perlygatekeeper2> I've tried html macro but this didn't turn out  
22:51 <@cjd> you could try using ((( and putting your blank lines inside of that and then )))  
22:52 <perlygatekeeper2> ok, hold on  
22:52 <@cjd> \* item (((  
22:52 <@cjd>    
22:52 <@cjd> {{code}} ... {{/code}}  
22:52 <@cjd>    
22:52 <@cjd> )))  
22:52 <perlygatekeeper2> I'll be damned, that worked  
22:53 <@cjd> cool  
22:53 <perlygatekeeper2> what's ((( ... ))) do  
22:53 <@cjd> it creates a seperate block  
22:53 <@cjd> so you can also do (% style="display:none" %)((( a whole bunch of stuff that nobody will see )))  
22:53 <perlygatekeeper2> well cjd... I owe you a beer  
22:53 <@cjd> thanks :)  
22:54 <@cjd> it was a wild guess on my part  
22:54 <perlygatekeeper2> no, really..  spent all day trying everything I could think of  
22:54 <@cjd> I didn't work too much in the renderer end  
22:54 <@cjd> glad it's working for you though  
22:55 <perlygatekeeper2> what part did you work on?  
22:55 <@cjd> Mostly storage related stuff.  
22:56 <perlygatekeeper2> is it database driven?  
22:56 <@cjd> db and NoSQL  
22:56 <perlygatekeeper2> cool  
22:56 <@cjd> The stuff I do is hard to notice unless it breaks.  
22:56 <perlygatekeeper2> that's the way it is in a LOT of computer/software related work  
22:57 <perlygatekeeper2> I was a sysadmin for YEARS  
22:57 <@cjd> yeap  
22:57 <perlygatekeeper2> my greatest successes were greeted with a 'huhn, I didn't notice anything?"  
22:57 <@cjd> indeed  
22:58 <perlygatekeeper2> hey, what's a good way to get a list of available css classes available by default inside xwiki?  
22:58 <@cjd> gotta make it glitch for a few seconds so the power goes out and the lights flicker then you run out pliers in hand like baywatch ;)  
22:59 <perlygatekeeper2> well, perhaps it would be better were I not to be in a swimsuit  
22:59 <@cjd> heh  
22:59 <@cjd> could use firebug or just poke around in the /resources/ directory, I don't think there's a comprehensive list anywhere  
22:59 <perlygatekeeper2> how long have you been involved in xwiki?  
22:59 <@cjd> 3 years or so  
23:00 <perlygatekeeper2> xwiki is pretty old, what was the first one?>  
23:01 <@cjd> I think c2wiki was from around '95  
23:01 <@cjd> and ofc mediawiki was from the early 2000's  
23:01 <perlygatekeeper2> damn, what could it do?  
23:01 <@cjd> not a whole lot :)  
23:01 <perlygatekeeper2> html was like version 1-2 in '95  
23:02 <@cjd> http://c2.com/cgi/wiki <-- there it is in action  
23:02 <perlygatekeeper2> no CSS, no tables, no super sub scripts  
23:02 <@cjd> no [[multi word links]] so all of the linked words had to be AnnoyingCamelCase  
23:03 <perlygatekeeper2> or\_with\_underscores\_which\_take\_forever\_to\_type and mess up word-wise movements in editors  
23:05 <@cjd> my personal preference is for camelCase when programming, even when doing C, that's probably just because I started with Java  
23:05 <perlygatekeeper2> wikipedia says wikiwikiweb was the first wiki  
23:05 <@cjd> ahh  
23:06 <perlygatekeeper2> man, it must be difficult to go from Java to C  
23:07 <@cjd> I find C to be easy because I wrote libraries from the ground up around my project  
23:07 <@cjd> it has "manual" garbage collection  
23:08 <perlygatekeeper2> hey, does xwiki have something like a Macro or Variable what one can set and use all over a page?  
23:08 <@cjd> there are wiki macros but they are global  
23:08 <perlygatekeeper2> it has "manual" everythign  
23:09 <@cjd> I wrote an allocator where you create the allocator and pass it to a (potentially leaky) function, then you free it after you are done  
23:09 <perlygatekeeper2> cjd is a masocist  
23:11 <@cjd> One nice thing about C is when you are off in a bad direction, you don't get very far. Languages like java let you go a long way in the wrong direction before you realize you have made spaghetticode.  
23:11 <perlygatekeeper2> it's all about a clear plan and organization  
23:11 <@cjd> indeed  
23:11 <@cjd> and being ready to try again when it turns out the clear plan wasn't  
23:12 <perlygatekeeper2> but sometimes a problem is vast and you make incorrect assumptions about what will be available when or that two concepts will work together when they clearly won't, noticed when serious coding starts  
23:13 <perlygatekeeper2> yes, my motto "the best time to start a software project is immediately after you've finished it"  
23:13 <@cjd> I like that  
23:13 <perlygatekeeper2> meaning that one's understanding of the problem/purpose will never be better than just after completion  
23:14 <perlygatekeeper2> so, ok how difficult is it to make a xwiki macro  
23:14 <@cjd> Someone I met who had been a CS professor said you need to write something 3 times, once to learn how to do it, once to learn how to do it right, and once to learn how to do it well.  
23:14 <perlygatekeeper2> I'm thinking of something like 'all box widths' which will return 650px  
23:15 <@cjd> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WikiMacroTutorial  
23:15 <@cjd> this might be a bit more advanced than you're looking for, then again it might be perfect...  
23:15 <perlygatekeeper2> yes, but unfortunately, the goals/requirements will change in incompatible ways after versions 1 and 2  
23:16 <perlygatekeeper2> that is a very nice tutorial  
23:17 <perlygatekeeper2> <- likes being 'old school' since he started tonight with NO IDEA there even was a #xwiki irc channel on freenode :)  
23:17 <perlygatekeeper2> take THAT google-using youngin's  
23:18 <@cjd> heh
